Immunoglobulin class switching can be used to change the class of the heavy

Isotypes are distinct forms of light or heavy chains which are present in all
members of a species, encoded at distinct genetic loci. Kappa and lambda are
isotypes of light chains. Delta (Î´), gamma:1 (Î³1), etc. are isotypes of heavy
chains. All isotypes can be readily found in all normal sera.
